Key Match Events: Framber Valdez threw seven no-hit innings
Josh Altuve hit a game-winning double off the wall in left field in the bottom of the ninth inning
Jake Meyers singled with one out in the ninth and scored easily from first when Altuve banged an 0-1 pitch from James McArthur off the left-field wall
Paul DeJong tied the game with a two-run homer in the top of the ninth off Houston closer Josh Hader
Josh Hader blew his first save since April 2
Post-Match Reflections: Joe Espada praised Jose Altuve's ability to find a way to wow them in crucial moments
Espada highlighted Framber Valdez's performance, emphasizing his efficiency, composure, and ability to get big outs and ground balls
DeJong complimented Valdez's variety of pitches and his ability to keep batters off balance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros have had five no-hit bids of at least seven innings this year, tying the 1989 Rangers and 1965 Reds for the most in one season in the expansion era (since 1961)
Framber Valdez threw a no-hitter on Aug. 1, 2023
Spencer Arrighetti carried a no-hitter into the eighth inning on Wednesday in Philadelphia
